Class Coordinate

  • java.lang.Object
    • Coordinate

  • public class Coordinate
extends java.lang.Object
    An immutable class storing x and y integers to allow for easier passing of pair values.
    Author:
    Steven Lowes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Coordinate(int x, int y)
      Create a new immutable pair object.

    • Method Summary

      Coordinate add(Coordinate coords2)
      Return a new Coordinate which has x and y values equal to the combined x and y values of this Coordinate and another passed Coordinate.

      Compares equality to another object, returns true if both x and y are equal.
      java.util.List<Coordinate> getAdjactents(int xSize, int ySize)
      Returns a list of the valid coordinates around this coordinate
      java.util.List<Coordinate> getBridges(int xSize, int ySize)
      Returns a list of valid coordinates that are in appropriate positions to be bridges to/from this coordinate

      int getY() 
      int hashCode()

      • valid

        public boolean valid(int sizeX,
                     int sizeY)
        Check that the coordinate values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than the bounds passed as parameters.
        Parameters:
        sizeX - The width of the game board.
        sizeY - The height of the game board.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating validity.

      • add

        public Coordinate add(Coordinate coords2)
        Return a new Coordinate which has x and y values equal to the combined x and y values of this Coordinate and another passed Coordinate. Such that newX = X + otherX and newY = Y + otherY
        Parameters:
        coords2 - Coordinate object to add to this one.
        Returns:
        new Coordinate equal to the addition of this and another Coordinate.
